dmca.title: DMCA notice to Google, Inc.
dmca.body:
My website sitemap page: http://www.hispanic-jobs.com/sitemap.php

Their website sitemap: http://www.automotivejobsonline.com/sitemap.php

My website job seeker registration form: http://www.hispanic-jobs.com/getstarted_jobseekers.php

Their website job seeker registration form: http://automotivejobsonline.com/show_content.php?id=1164822194

My website employer registration form: http://www.hispanic-jobs.com/getstarted_employers.php

Their website employer registration form: http://automotivejobsonline.com/show_content.php?id=1164822296

Also, on the following company registration page:

http://automotivejobsonline.com/company.php?action=new

The sentence starts with "Please take a moment to register with us. You will have the benefit of posting jobs and searching our resume database. Registering for an account does not obligate you to purchase a membership or job postings.

And at the end of the registration it ends with "If you have Spam protection software in place, please make sure that you add our e-mail address to your authorized contact list or otherwise you may not receive e-mails when job seekers apply to your open positions. The e-mail address to add is support@automotivejobsonline.com.

This was also written by myself and you can see this on Hispanic-Jobs.com at: http://www.hispanic-jobs.com/company.php?action=new

Answer to Question #2:

They are infringing upon my web design and written content as indicated on the above links

Answer to Question #3:

Simone Emmons, (818) 674-9621 cell, (818) 530-4852, ext. 4 or simone@hispanic-jobs.com or simone2@ix.netcom.com, 11271 Ventura Blvd. #151, Studio City, CA 91604

Answer to Question #4:

Automotivejobsonline.com, their e-mail is support@automotivejobsonline.com, contact person is Mike Aldrich

Revised letter regarding reference Re: [133636458] fax dated April 6, 2007 - added additional links of missing pages which refer to copyright infringements.

April 9, 2007

Google, Inc.
Attn: Google Legal Support, DMCA Counter Notification
1600 Amphitheatre Parkway
Mountain View, CA 94043

Re: Copyright infringement by Automotivejobsonline.com (website design & content)

Dear Sir/Madam:

I am the owner of the website Hispanic-Jobs.com and I am writing this letter to notify you that one of website listed on Google (Automotivejobsonline.com) is clearly using my website design, images and written content text on their website at Automotivejobsonline.com. Hispanic-Jobs.com has been around since 2004 and they just recently launched their website.

Based on the form that you have listed online, I am providing you more detailed information about my case:

Answer to Question #1:

Automotivejobsonline.com has copied my website design including exact colors, image buttons and the text that is written throughout the website. When you view their website they even copied the introduction text on "About Us" plus all the features we offer. The text that I have written on my website is clearly throughout their website on many pages and it seems that they have just changed their website name in the text.

Here is a comparison:

My website home page: http://www.hispanic-jobs.com/

Their website: http://www.automotivejobsonline.com/

My website "About Us: page: http://www.hispanic-jobs.com/aboutus.php

Their website "About Us" page: http://automotivejobsonline.com/about_us.php

I wrote the following text on my website: Hispanic-Jobs.com was founded by a Human Resources professional in 2004 and is the career site for employers who want to reach bilingual/Spanish-speaking professionals nationwide.

I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials described above as allegedly infringing is not.....
I have a good faith belief that use of the copyright...authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law.

I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed."

Regards,

Simone Emmons
Hispanic-Jobs.com
11271 Ventura Blvd.
Studio City, CA 91604
(818) 674-9621
